description: From Middle English pynner, pynnere, pinnere, equivalent to pin +‎ -er.

entries.meaning: Agent noun of pin; one who pins.
examples: This wrestler or pahlwan was a devotee of the old type of wrestling, in which the opponent is thrown down and pinned, unable to get out from under the pinner.

entries.meaning: A headdress like a cap, with long lappets.
A cloth band for a gown.

description: Variant of pinder, from Middle English pindere, pyndere, pundere, pendere, equivalent to pend (“to pen”) +‎ -er.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) One who pins or impounds cattle; a pinder.
